description:
Ramesh is working on a problem given by his teacher, the problem states that he is given an array(say nums), 

He has to find such an array (say ans) such that ans[i]=leftsum[i]+rightsum[i]. 
Help Ramesh to solve the problem.
leftsum[i] is the sum of all the elements to the left of index i in the array nums, if there is no such element leftsum[i]=0;

rightsum[i] is the sum of all the elements to the right of index i in the array nums, if there is no such element rightsum[i]=0;

### `Example 1`

#### `Input:`
```
nums = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
```
#### `Output:` 
```
[14, 13, 12, 11, 10]
```
### **Example 2**

#### `Input` 
```
nums =[1, 2, -3, 4, -5]
```
#### `Output:` 
```
[-2, -3, 2, -5, 4]
```


### Constraints :
1 <= nums.length <= 1000

-10000 <= nums[i] <= 10000
title: SOLO SUM
